Name: clefting/splitting of energy wood | clefting of energy wood | EN15804GD, U
Category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/02:Forestry and logging/022:Logging/0220:Logging
Description: Motormanual production with a mobile diesel powered clefting device.;;For the production of cleft timber, residual wood (branches, small trees from tending or thinning or misbuilt large diameter trees) are cut into one meter long log pieces, loaded onto a tractor-driven trailer, and transported to the forest road. The logs are split along the grain with a mobile, tractor-powered clefting device; the resulting cleft timber is piled along the forest road for natural drying; small-diameter logs and branches are piled without splitting.
